title: Death Investigation in Oxon Hill Now Ruled Homicide
body:
Detectives who have
been investigating a death since August have
received results from the autopsy indicating the manner of death was
homicide.  The victim is 37-year-old Itimia Gray of E Street Southeast in
Washington, D.C. A
reward of up to $25,000 is being offered for information leading to an arrest
and indictment in this case.

On August 15,
at about 9:15 am, patrol officers responded to the 5100 block of Deal Drive in
Oxon Hill for a death investigation. When they arrived, the officers discovered
the victim outside where she was pronounced dead. An autopsy was
conducted to determine the cause of the victim’s death. On October 31,
our detectives were notified by the medical examiner that the cause of the
victim’s death was a gunshot to the upper body. 

Detectives are
working to identify a suspect(s) and motive in this case.

 Anyone with
information on this case is asked to call the Homicide Unit at 301-772-4925.
Callers wishing to remain anonymous may call Crime Solvers
at 1-866-411-TIPS (8477), or go online at www.pgcrimesolvers.com,
or use the “P3 Tips” mobile app (search “P3 Tips” in the Apple Store or Google
Play to download the app onto your mobile device.)
